marklogic.body:
Levels of violence are relative and unique to the viewer. I read another review that hammered the film for being too violent. Clearly, the violence upset that reviewer but not this one. Â Whether or not the violence upsets is more a function of the viewer's preferences, not the filmmaker's.Â
This reviewer clearly sets forth individual opinion with the statement: "If you're in the market for a terrific film that revolves around teenagers murdering one another...". Â So, this reviewer seems to come from the standpont that watching teenagers murdering each other is pretty sweet. Â But, it's an opinion.
I will probably see the film. Likely, I will consider it to be very violent, because I have little tolerance for viewing violence. Thus, I may consider the filmmaker to have captured the violence of the book well enough without becoming a gory slaughterfest that might make me Vomit and have nightmares for a couple of weeks; but, that's my preference. Many other folks will think differently.Â
So, just read smartly. Understand where the author of this review is coming from, make your own decision, and Act accordingly.
